metadata.metaValue:
# Payload Layer

Creates **payload.usd** file.

Stores the prims with their (optional) model and look variants referencing geometry, materials and bindings layers.

Saves the payload layer and the bindings layers.

# Component Layer
Creates **\<model name\>.usd** file.

Stores the following data:
- Default prim "/\<model name\>".
- Class prim "/\_\_class\_\_/\<model name\>".
- Inherits on "/\<model name\>" prim to the "/\_\_class\_\_" prim.
- Payload on "/\<model name\>" prim to the payload layer.
- Model and Look VariantSets to allow selection when unloaded.

Saves the component layer.

# Changes applied after the component is saved

- The material library layer is made editable to allow other runtimes to author it after the Bifrost graph execution (example of such runtime is the LookdevX editor).
- When *Save Model* is on, replace the component by a cube to indicate in viewport.

# Nested loops inside this compound

```
# iterate_on_model_variants compound
for each model in model variants:
    # reference a usd file, etc.

    # iterate_on_look_variants compound
    for each look in look variants:
         # bind materials, etc.
```

# Create the stage with the default prim

`/ModelName [def Xform] (kind = component)`

# Save Payload Stage

This will save the payload layer and the binding layers. 

Since the material library layer is in read only mode, it **can not be saved** from here!

# Create the Model variantSet (if more than one model variant)

For each model variant:
- Adds the *extentsHint* attribute.
- Adds the *GeomModelAPI* applied schema.
- Reference the "model.usd" file of each purpose (if any).

The generated prim hierarchy will follow such pattern:
```
`--Component_Name [def Xform] (kind = component)
 |--proxy [def Scope] (kind = group)
 |   `--mdl1 [def Scope] (kind = group, references = @geo/mdl1_proxy.usd@)
 |       `--mtl [def Scope] (kind = group)
 `--render [def Scope] (kind = group)
     `--mdl1 [def Scope] (kind = group, references = @geo/mdl1_render.usd@)
         `--mtl [def Scope] (kind = group)
```
- Iterate on look variants (dive in the compound to see final hierarchy with materials).
Create a simple hierarchy if there are no variants and only the default purpose.
Create the model with or without variantSets

# Adds reference to materials layer and binding layers

The generated prim hierarchy will follow such pattern:

```
`--Component_Name [def Xform] (kind = component)
 |--proxy [def Scope]
 |   `--mdl1 [def Scope] (kind = group, references = @geo/mdl1_proxy.usd@)
 |       `--mtl [def Scope] (kind = group, references = @mtl/material_libary.usd@)
 `--render [def Scope]
     `--mdl1 [def Scope] (kind = group, references = @geo/mdl1_render.usd@)
         `--mtl [def Scope] (kind = group, references = @mtl/material_libary.usd@)
```

# Add Reference to Material Library Layer

The first iteration adds a reference to the material library layer in the default or render purpose.

If there is a proxy purpose, the second iteration adds the same reference layer to it.

# Create the binding layer and author it

Creates a temporary stage to add material bindings and primvars overrides to the binding layer. This stage uses the binding layer as its sublayer. It is referenced in the payload layer.
On Windows, drive letter is stored in lowercase in the USD file
On Windows, drive letter is stored in lowercase in the USD file
